title: [jit][script] Support `dim` wrapping
body_html:
The following does not compile:

import torch
@torch.jit.script
def unsqueezel(x):
    return x.unsqueeze(dim=-1)
x = torch.randn((2, 2), requires_grad=True)
unsqueezel(x)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-8-6b2f4059fc46> in <module>()
      1 import torch
----> 2 @torch.jit.script
      3 def unsqueezel(x):
      4     return x.unsqueeze(dim=-1)
      5 x = torch.randn((2, 2), requires_grad=True)

~/pytorch/pytorch/torch/jit/__init__.py in script(fn)
    528     rcb = createResolutionCallback()
    529     ast = get_jit_ast(fn)
--> 530     graph = _jit_script_compile(ast, rcb)
    531     return torch._C.GraphExecutor(graph, True)
    532

RuntimeError:
Unexpected kind of attribute value: 45:
@torch.jit.script
def unsqueezel(x):
    return x.unsqueeze(dim=-1)
                           ~~ <--- HERE

The expected behavior should be that the dim wraps around (to match torch semantics).

cc @zdevito

body:
The following does not compile:
```
import torch
@torch.jit.script
def unsqueezel(x):
    return x.unsqueeze(dim=-1)
x = torch.randn((2, 2), requires_grad=True)
unsqueezel(x)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-8-6b2f4059fc46> in <module>()
      1 import torch
----> 2 @torch.jit.script
      3 def unsqueezel(x):
      4     return x.unsqueeze(dim=-1)
      5 x = torch.randn((2, 2), requires_grad=True)

~/pytorch/pytorch/torch/jit/__init__.py in script(fn)
    528     rcb = createResolutionCallback()
    529     ast = get_jit_ast(fn)
--> 530     graph = _jit_script_compile(ast, rcb)
    531     return torch._C.GraphExecutor(graph, True)
    532

RuntimeError:
Unexpected kind of attribute value: 45:
@torch.jit.script
def unsqueezel(x):
    return x.unsqueeze(dim=-1)
                           ~~ <--- HERE
```
The expected behavior should be that the dim wraps around (to match torch semantics).

cc @zdevito
